title: Grounding Rules
text: Never invent KPI values. Use only numbers present in metricSnapshot and supportingFacts. If a requested KPI is unavailable, state that it is unavailable and describe what data fields are required.

title: Curated Dataset Profile v1
text: Dataset profile is dynamic and depends on the currently uploaded workbook and active filters. Use runtime context (metricSnapshot and insightContext) for current row counts, status mix, join coverage, funnel shape, and trend deltas. This document is guidance only and must not be treated as current uploaded-data truth.

title: KPI Field Mapping Glossary
text: Primary fact table is 3_Application_Pipeline keyed by Application_ID with Candidate_ID and Requisition_ID. Candidate attributes come from 2_Candidate. Requisition attributes come from 1_Requisition. Hiring cost from 6_Hiring_Cost. Posting analytics from 7_Job_Posting_Analytics where Job_ID maps to Requisition_ID.

title: Qualified Candidates Availability
text: Definition: average qualified candidates per critical-skill requisition. Recommended proxy formula: count(distinct candidate_id where skill_match_percentage >= 80 and critical_skill_flag=Y) divided by count(distinct requisition_id where critical_skill_flag=Y). Threshold reference: green above 5.0, amber 3.5 to 5.0, red below 3.5.

title: Talent Pool Skill Readiness
text: Definition: average Skill_Match_Percentage across unique candidates in the filtered pipeline. Threshold reference: green >= 70 percent, amber 66 to 70 percent, red below 66 percent.

title: Active External Connections
text: Definition: unique external candidates with recruiter activity. Proxy fields: Candidate Type (Internal/External), Recruiter_ID, Time_Spent_Matching (hrs). Threshold reference: green > 1000, amber 800 to 1000, red below 800.

title: Critical Skill Hiring Capability
text: Definition: percent of critical-skill requisitions with at least one hired candidate. Formula: count(distinct critical reqs with Status=Hired) divided by count(distinct critical reqs). Threshold reference: green > 90 percent, amber 84 to 90 percent, red below 84 percent.

title: Time to Present Critical Skills
text: Definition: average days from requisition open date to first candidate application for critical requisitions, excluding negative deltas caused by data anomalies. Threshold reference: green < 7.0 days, amber 7.0 to 9.0 days, red > 9.0 days.

title: Talent Pool Size and Variety
text: Definition: average unique candidates per requisition in the filtered scope. Threshold reference: green > 10, amber 7 to 10, red below 7.

title: Time to Next Step Decision
text: Definition: average stage duration using Stage_Exit_Date minus Stage_Enter_Date for rows with both dates present. Threshold reference: green < 3.0 days, amber 3.0 to 4.0 days, red > 4.0 days.

title: Time Spent Matching
text: Definition: average matching hours per unique candidate from recruiter activity. Field: Time_Spent_Matching (hrs). Threshold reference: green < 6.0 hrs, amber 6.0 to 7.0 hrs, red > 7.0 hrs.

title: Time to CV Response
text: Definition: average Recruiter_Response_Time in hours from pipeline records. Threshold reference: green < 24 hours, amber 24 to 30 hours, red > 30 hours.

title: Recruiting Experience Rating
text: Definition: candidate satisfaction proxy on a 5-point scale. If Candidate_NPS is on 10-point scale, use proxy Candidate_NPS/2. Threshold reference: green > 4.2, amber 4.0 to 4.2, red below 4.0.

title: Incomplete Applications
text: Definition: percent of candidates where Application_Completed (Y/N)=N among records with completion flag available. Threshold reference: green < 15 percent, amber 15 to 20 percent, red > 20 percent.

title: Time to Apply
text: Definition: average minutes between Application_Start_Time and Application_Submit_Time for candidates with both timestamps. Threshold reference: green < 10 minutes, amber 10 to 12 minutes, red > 12 minutes.

title: Ease of Applying Rating
text: Definition: average Application_Ease_Rating on a 5-point scale. Threshold reference: green > 4.0, amber 3.8 to 4.0, red below 3.8.

title: Diverse Candidates Attraction
text: Definition: percent of unique candidates with Diversity_Flag=Y in the filtered scope. Threshold reference: green > 40 percent, amber 35 to 40 percent, red below 35 percent.

title: Diverse Talent Pipeline
text: Definition: percent of hired candidates with Diversity_Flag=Y among hired candidates with diversity flag available. Threshold reference: green > 40 percent, amber 32 to 40 percent, red below 32 percent.

title: Active Applicants
text: Definition: unique candidates currently in active status (Status=Active). Threshold reference: green > 8000, amber 6000 to 8000, red below 6000.

title: Cost per Acquisition
text: Definition: total hiring cost across requisitions divided by total applications in scope. Inputs: Total_Hiring_Cost from 6_Hiring_Cost and Application_ID from pipeline. Threshold reference: green < 2500, amber 2500 to 3200, red > 3200.

title: Candidates Presented vs Offers Made
text: Definition: offer yield from presented/interviewed candidates. Recommended implementation: offers_made divided by interviewed candidates in scope, with clear denominator notes.

title: Job Posting Effectiveness
text: Definition: applications received divided by job views using 7_Job_Posting_Analytics. Threshold reference: green > 8 percent, amber 6 to 8 percent, red below 6 percent.

title: Hires from Competitors
text: Definition: percent of hired candidates with Is_Competitor (Y/N)=Y among hires with competitor flag available. Threshold reference: green > 15 percent, amber 12 to 15 percent, red below 12 percent.

title: Hiring Manager Feedback Time
text: Definition: average days between Interview_Date and Feedback_Date in 5_Interview_Offer for valid sequences. Threshold reference: green < 2.0 days, amber 2.0 to 2.5 days, red > 2.5 days.

title: JD Criteria Match
text: Definition: average Skill_Match_Percentage for candidates in scope as a proxy for JD alignment. Threshold reference: green > 75 percent, amber 72 to 75 percent, red below 72 percent.

title: Interviewed vs Offered Ratio
text: Definition: interviewed candidates divided by offers made, displayed as ratio 1:X. Reference target: 1:4. Below target can indicate weaker screening precision or panel consistency issues.

title: Readiness Red KPI Response Playbook
text: When readiness KPIs are red: focus first on critical requisitions, launch source-specific sourcing sprints, enforce shortlist SLAs, and rebalance recruiter capacity to critical roles. Track impact weekly via qualified candidates per critical requisition and time to first qualified slate.

title: Momentum Red KPI Response Playbook
text: When momentum KPIs are red: enforce response and feedback SLAs, auto-escalate stale requisitions, and standardize interview scheduling windows. Track stage aging p50 and p90 each week and identify top delaying stages.

title: Experience Red KPI Response Playbook
text: When experience KPIs are red: simplify application flow, reduce mandatory fields, improve mobile upload reliability, and instrument step-level drop-off. Prioritize fixes where incomplete application rate and time-to-apply are worst.

title: Diversity Red KPI Response Playbook
text: When diversity KPIs are red: expand sourcing channels, standardize panel evaluation rubrics, and monitor progression parity by stage. Compare diverse share at apply versus hire and run weekly parity reviews.

title: Economics Red KPI Response Playbook
text: When economics KPIs are red: optimize channel spend, reduce agency reliance for non-critical roles, tighten intake quality, and shorten feedback cycles. Monitor cost per acquisition, posting effectiveness, and offer yield together to avoid local optimizations.
